list_definition.definition: something, especially of glass or metal, that reflects light, heat etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Having reflectors makes cyclists much more visible to car drivers in the dark.

list_ex_of_english: Many motorists know them; they are indeed most effective as reflectors.
There is one good reason why we should do something about these road reflectors now.
Are we to understand that no tests of these reflectors are carried out?
Whether we switch off the light or turn down the reflectors so that they do not shine in people's eyes makes a real difference.
People are to receive a fixed penalty for a lighting offence or for lack of reflectors which are required by law.
He says that he feels that the vehicles should be a light colour at the back and that reflectors should always be fitted.
The old type of lamp had dipping reflectors; with the new type it is the filament which goes out.
Certainly where a system of street lighting exists it would be very much better to have the signs illuminated at night, instead of using reflectors.
